reasoning='1.  Start with the climb requirement – this is the hardest case and therefore sets the gear ratio.
   •  Assume a target robot mass m = 12 kg (small outdoor rover including payload and battery).
   •  Force needed on a 10 ° incline:
        F_grade = m·g·sin(10°)  ≈ 12·9.81·0.1736  ≈ 20.4 N
        F_roll  = m·g·cos(10°)·C_rr ≈ 12·9.81·0.9848·0.015 ≈ 1.7 N
        Total   F_climb           ≈ 22.1 N
   •  Choose a practical wheel diameter d = 0.12 m  (radius r_w = 0.06 m) – good clearance, small and light.
   •  Wheel torque needed:
        T_w,req = F_climb · r_w ≈ 22.1 N · 0.06 m ≈ 1.33 N·m
   •  Motor can deliver 0.30 N·m at 24 V.  With 90 % gear efficiency, wheel torque available is
        T_w,avail = 0.30 N·m · r · 0.90
     Solve r ≥ T_w,req / (0.30·0.90) ≈ 1.33 / 0.27 ≈ 4.93.  Select r = 6 to leave healthy margin.

2.  Verify top-speed requirement with the chosen r and d.
   •  Motor rated-torque speed = 4000 rpm (no-load is higher, so 4000 rpm is conservative).
   •  Wheel speed = 4000 rpm / 6 ≈ 667 rpm.
   •  Linear speed v_max = (π·d) · (rpm/60) ≈ (π·0.12) · (667/60) ≈ 4.2 m/s (> 3 m/s). Requirement met.

3.  Check 30-minute level-cruise energy at 2.5 m/s.
   •  On level ground: F_roll ≈ m·g·C_rr ≈ 12·9.81·0.015 ≈ 1.77 N.
     Aerodynamic drag at 2.5 m/s (ρ=1.2 kg/m³, A=0.05 m², assume C_d ≈ 1) is only ≈ 0.19 N.
     Total F_cruise ≈ 1.96 N.
   •  Mechanical power P_mech = F · v ≈ 1.96 N · 2.5 m/s ≈ 4.9 W.
   •  Electrical power P_elec ≈ P_mech / (motor η · gear η) ≈ 4.9 W / (0.8·0.9) ≈ 6.8 W.
   •  30 min (0.5 h) energy ≈ 6.8 W · 0.5 h ≈ 3.4 Wh.
   •  Adding generous overhead for accelerations, control electronics, aging, and winter operation (× ≈ 10) gives ≈ 35 Wh.
     Select a round, commercially common 24 V × 2 Ah pack → C = 48 Wh (here rounded to 50 Wh) – ample margin (> 30 min).

4.  Mass consistency.
   •  A 24 V-2 Ah lithium pack ≈ 0.5 kg.
   •  Two small geared motors, chassis, sensors, etc. fit comfortably in the remaining 11.5 kg, so total m = 12 kg is realistic.

All three performance constraints (top speed ≥ 3 m/s, 10 ° climb, 30 min cruise) are satisfied with the selected parameters.' config=ConfigFile(battery_capacity=50.0, gear_ratio=6.0, wheel_diameter=0.12, body_mass=12.0)
